eating healthy.title: what fats add to your diet

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: For many years, we were sure that you should eat as little fat as possible to manage your cholesterol levels and weight. However, it turns out that your body needs fat for energy, vitamin absorption, and heart and brain health. And not all fats are created equal.

option.title: Which fats are unhealthy?
option.Dics: Saturated fats and trans fats are generally considered unhealthy. They contribute to heart issues, weight gain, and high cholesterol levels. Saturated fats are mostly found in animal foods and trans fats in processed foods. We recommend limiting them to about 10% of your daily caloric intake.You can usually see the amount of those fats on food labels.

option.title: What foods can I get healthy fats from?
option.Dics: Avocado Avocados are abundant in monounsaturated fat, which can help maintain healthy cholesterol levels. Enjoy it on toast, in salads, or even use it instead of butter in baking!

option.title: Olive oil
option.Dics: All types of olive oil are extremely high in monounsaturated fats, which help manage cholesterol levels. Olive oil also has antioxidants and anti-inflammatory qualities, and accounts for better heart health and management of blood sugar levels and weight.

option.title: Olive oil
option.Dics: All types of olive oil are extremely high in monounsaturated fats, which help manage cholesterol levels. Olive oil also has antioxidants and anti-inflammatory qualities, and accounts for better heart health and management of blood sugar levels and weight.

option.title: nuts
option.Dics: They have a high proportion of healthy fats that help prevent heart diseases and type 2 diabetes. Nuts are also high in protein, fiber, vitamin E, potassium, and magnesium, which makes them the perfect healthy snack.However, some people are allergic to nuts, so pay attention to packaging if you have a nut allergy.

option.title: Whole eggs
option.Dics: You might've heard that eggs are high in cholesterol and thus unhealthy. But a recent study shows that eggs don't impact cholesterol levels for the majority of people.Besides, they are a powerhouse of vitamins, minerals, and protein, which makes them a great food to eat when trying to lose weight.

option.title: Conclusion
option.Dics: Fats are an essential component of a balanced diet. Choose foods that are high in good unsaturated fats, limit meals that are high in saturated fat, and avoid foods that are high in bad trans fat. Consult a dietitian or licensed nutritionist to learn more about adding healthy fats into your diet.

eating healthy.title: antioxidant:why they matter and whats foods

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: You might've heard that antioxidants are essential for your health. But what exactly is their purpose? Well, they destroy the compounds called free radicals that cause damage in your body. They appear due to cell metabolism and from exposure to pollution, radiation, cigarette smoke, and specific medications.Eating refined or processed foods can also lead to a higher number of free radicals. If that number is high enough, it can increase the risk of heart disease, diabetes, and cancer.

option.title: Where do I get antioxidants from?
option.Dics: 1. Blueberries, strawberries, raspberries They are high in antioxidants called anthocyanins. And apart from neutralizing free radicals, they delay the decline in brain function that happens because of aging. They also reduce blood pressure and cholesterol levels.

option.title: 2. Dark chocolate
option.Dics: It is one of the richest sources of antioxidants out there. The reason is that dark chocolate has the highest content of cocoa among all types of chocolate, which makes it a delicious nutritious powerhouse! The antioxidants in cocoa lower the risk of inflammation and reduce the risk of heart disease by stabilizing blood pressure. They also increase the levels of good cholesterol and prevent bad cholesterol from oxidizing, which could lead to inflammation of blood vessels.

option.title: 3. Kale, spinach, broccoli, cauliflower
option.Dics: These veggies are loaded with minerals, vitamins, and antioxidants. Kale has large contents of the essential vitamins A, K, and C, and calcium. And spinach contains minerals that help protect your eyes from harmful UV rays and free radicals. Healthy tip: Red kale contains twice as many antioxidants as the green one, so add it to your diet to get even more health benefits!

These are just a few of the foods high in antioxidants that have a great effect on your health. Of course, a varied diet and regular consumption of them will help their long-term effect on the body. You can consult your dietitian for more tips on foods rich in antioxidants to include in your diet.

eating healthy.title: detox are a mythyl what do you need to

option.title: Detox? What Is It? Does It Work?
option.Dics: There are other drinks known as 'detox'. Some of them work not only as detoxifiers but also can help people focus or relax. What about them?
According to Edzard Ernst, emeritus professor of complementary medicine at the University of Exeter, there are two types of detox: one is respectable and the other isn't.

The respectable one is the medical treatment of people with lifethreatening drug addictions. The otheris the word being hijacked by entrepreneurs, quacks and charlatans to sell a bogus treatment that allegedly detoxifies your body of toxins you're supposed to have accumulated, he tells The Guardian.

option.title: Are Detox Drinks Any Different?
option.Dics: Detox smoothies seem to be the most popular cleanse method. They are usually fruit-or plant-based juices.Considering that 3/4 of the people in the USA alone don't consume enough fruits and veggies, this may be a good option. Especially if you make the drink yourself using raw and fresh ingredients.

However, drinking only smoothies and cutting out other food and calling it a 'detox' is the point where you're crossing the line from healthful to harmful.Fruit and veggie smoothies can be good additions to your diet but should not replace all your nutrition.

option.title: How About Other Drinks Called 'Detox'?
option.Dics: There are other drinks known as 'detox'. Some of them work not only as detoxifiers but also can help people focus, or relax. What about them?Dietitians are to clear the air here.

option.title: Green tea
option.Dics: Green tea promises extra focus and concentration, as it contains caffeine and L-theanine. Research showed that when combined, these two were found to particularly improve performance in attention-switching tasks and alertness, but to a lesser extent than caffeine alone.In the end, the study provided quite relatable proof, showing that Ltheanine and caffeine have clear beneficial effects on sustained attention, memory, and suppression of distraction.

option.title: Apple cider vinegar
option.Dics: Apple cider vinegar has been shown to slow digestion and may help boost weight loss.It has also been shown to lower blood sugar levels.

option.title: Ginger
option.Dics: Ginger is thought to be a detoxifier but is proven to help reduce inflammation.Also, it is believed to give you an energy boost as it has been shown to improve insulin and blood sugar levels.

option.title: Summary
option.Dics: Detox diets are a myth. You should be able to distinguish a real detox from a 'commercial' one.If you still want to try a program or something else, read the fine print, consult with your doctor, and keep in mind that the result is likely to be short-term.

option.title: Maintaining a Healthy Weight
option.Dics: Reaching and maintaining a healthy weight is essential for your overall health.

option.title: Why Is It Important to Maintain Healthy Weight?
option.Dics: • You lower the risk of heart disease, diabetes, and high blood pressure • You get better sleep • You feel better and more energized • You exercise with ease and pleasure

option.title: What Is Healthy Weight?
option.Dics: Even though numbers on your scales alone won't tell a lot about your health condition, it can see the tendency where you're going.Also, Body Mass Index (BMI) is a value that can show whether your weight is healthy.

option.title: What Is BMI?
option.Dics: BMI shows whether a person has the correct weight for their height. BMI helps to indicate whether a person is underweight, has a healthy weight, excess weight, or obesity.

option.title: BMI Formula
option.Dics: This is a BMI formula, where kg is your weight in kilograms and m is your height in meters.BMI = kg/m2

option.title: How to Interpret BMI?
option.Dics: • Underweight — below 18.5 • Healthy Weight —18.5 - 24.9 • Overweight — 25.0 - 29.9 • Obese — 30.0 and above

option.title: Is BMI to Be Trusted?
option.Dics: BMI gives you a general overview on your weight. However, it doesn't take into account any unique features of your body. Also, it does not take into account race/ethnicity or even gender! It is not the most reliable measure or indicator of health.

option.title: Same Weight, Different Bodies
option.Dics: Same weight doesn't mean that people have identical health conditions. Keep in mind that fat weighs less than muscles. Thus, athletes might weigh more than overweight people.Number doesn't mean anything. Context is very important.

option.title: Closing Remarks
option.Dics: All humans are unique, which is why your healthy weight might not be the same as it is for your friend.

healthy weight.title: how to determine your healthy weight

option.title: Body Fat Percentage
option.Dics: Your body fat percentage can be calculated by dividing your fat mass by your total weight, measured via a body fat scale, MRI, or CT scan. • 15-20% body fat is considered acceptable for men. • 25-31% body fat is considered acceptable for women. A higher body fat level may indicate that you are overweight or obese which can cause serious health problems.

option.title: Waist-to-stature ratio (WSR)
option.Dics: It is another screening tool used to indicate healthy weight or increased risks of serious health conditions.WSR = waist circumference (cm)/ your height (cm) • 0.5 or lower is likely to indicate a healthy weight.

option.title: What Is Healthy WHR?
option.Dics: • A ratio of 0.8 and 0.9 in women and men, respectively, indicates there is a low risk of CV problems. • A ratio of 0.8-0.89 for women and 0.9-0.99 for men indicates a moderate risk of CVD. • And a ratio of 0.9 for women and 1.0 in men, or higher, indicates an increased risk of cardiovascular disease.

option.title: Waist-to-hip Ratio (WHR)
option.Dics: Your waist-to-hip ratio is the ratio of your waist circumference to your hip circumference.Formula: WHR = waist circumference (cm)/ hip circumference (cm) The lower the number, the more likely it is that your weight is appropriate for you and you therefore have a lower risk of developing cardiovascular problems.

option.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
option.Dics: The BMI is a common measure that determines someone's weight category based on their weight and height. It can be calculated by dividing your weight (kg) by your height (m) squared. - Normal weight BMIs fall within the range of 18.5-24.9.- Underweight is when your BMI is less than 18.5.- Overweight is when your BMI is between 25-29.9.- Obese is when your BMI is more than 30.

option.title: Healthy Weight Is an Individual Thing
option.Dics: There's no universal healthy weight for everyone as a number of factors need to be taken into consideration, like the following:• Age • Gender • Body fat distribution • Body shape • Muscle-fat ratio There are various ways to figure out how much you should weigh.

healthy weight.title: how intermittent fasting can change your

option.title: What Exactly Is Intermittent Fasting?
option.Dics: This method consists of giving your body a break from eating for an exact number of hours. You have 2 windows.• The eating window, when you can eat apreferred number of meals Fasting window, when you stop eating.

option.title: Fasting Window: What to Eat and Drink?
option.Dics: During the fasting window, you can consume calorie-free foods and beverages. These might be plain or lemon water, diet carbonated drinks with no sugar, unsweetened teas, and black coffee.

option.title: Eating Window: What to Eat and Drink?
option.Dics: In the eating window, all food is allowed. However, if you are aiming to support your health, it is better to avoid certain unsustainable food groups. Fast foods, deep-fried dishes, and sugary desserts are to be avoided.

option.title: What to Eat After Fasting?
option.Dics: After fasting for a certain number of hours the body needs satisfying and nutritious meals: veggies, proteinrich foods, healthy fats, and complex carbs. Make sure that you have a balanced meal right after fasting.

option.title: Important Healthy Diet Rule
option.Dics: Follow the rule: Fill half of your plate with veggies. In another quarter of it, place seafood, fish, or dairy products, and what's left is for carbs - preferably the ones rich in fiber.

option.title: How Would This Help Me Lose Weight?
option.Dics: It helps lower the bad type of cholesterol. Decreased levels of bad cholesterol can boost metabolism and lower blood sugar. After fasting for at least 12 hours, the insulin levels reduce and your liver works better.

option.title: Drink Water
option.Dics: Starting your day with a glass of water can also help your metabolism, as well as mental clarity and overall focus throughout the day.Most of the people who practice any type of fasting feel a boost of energy and an increased immune system.

option.title: Closing Remarks
option.Dics: Keep in mind there are many factors other than diet and physical activity that may affect your weight, such as sleep, stress, and even genetics!

healthy weight.title: how to maintain your healthy weight?

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: Being at a healthy weight is your key to a longer life. However, just achieving it is not enough. Now you need to learn to maintain it.

option.title: Habits for Maintaining Healthy Weight
option.Dics: • Regular physical activity. At least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity a week or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity activity. • Adding more fruits and veggies to your diet. • Proper hydration. Women should consume 2.7 liters of liquid a day, while 3.7 liters will be enough for men.

option.title: Habits for Maintaining Healthy Weight
option.Dics: • Limit refined sugar consumption. This includes reducing the amount of sweetened beverages, junk food, and processed foods you consume. • Don't neglect protein sources, like meats, fish, and beans. • Go for high-quality carbs.

option.title: Habits for Maintaining Healthy Weight
option.Dics: • Calculate the amount of calories you should consume taking into consideration your lifestyle. • Sit less, move more. • Make sure you get 7-9 hours of sleep.

healthy weight.title: 4 thing worth maintaing a healthy weight?

option.title: Healthy Weight for Active Life
option.Dics: Having a healthy weight can help you lead an active and healthy life.

option.title: According to the American Heart Association, keeping your weight in the healthy range will:
option.Dics: - Decrease the risks of developing diabetes, bone and heart problems, and certain cancers - Result in better blood circulation - Provide an energy boost and help you feel better about yourself

option.title: Risks of Overweight and Obesity
option.Dics: Losing weight is almost never an easy thing to do. However, long-term obesity or being overweight is associated with the following• Sleep apnea • Kidney disease • Type 2 diabetes • Heart disease • Fatty liver disease • High blood pressure • Bone issues • Certain types of cancer • Pregnancy problems

option.title: Closing Remarks
option.Dics: Maintain a healthy weight and live a better, more active life.

healthy weight.title: how to drink water to lose weight

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: Water is necessary for humans, just as nutritious food, good sleep, and regular exercise.

option.title: With Proper Hydration, You Will...
option.Dics: • Feel more focused • Stay energized • Have toned muscles • Have good skin

option.title: Also, You Will...
option.Dics: • Improve your digestion • Keep your kidneys functioning • Make weight loss easier

option.title: Well, You Get It...
option.Dics: How can you turn water into your ultimate weight-loss tool?

option.title: What to DO?
option.Dics: 1. Drink water before your meals. This trick helps reduce appetite and decrease calorie intake.2. Replace sugar-sweetened beverages with plain water. This greatly reduces calorie intake.3. Drink water all day. When intermittent fasting, insulin levels lower and urine output will increase so it’s important to drink plenty of water to avoid fatigue.
Weight Loss Checklist For Beginners

option.title: #1. Exercise
option.Dics: Do 150 minutes of moderate- intensity physical activity a week or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity  activity a week. This will help to control your weight and boost your weight loss results.

option.title: #2. Control Your Daily Calorie Intake
option.Dics: The principle of losing weight is as simple as ABC. You need to consume fewer calories than you burn.Until you follow this principle, you won't gain weight, even if you might have chocolate once in a while.

option.title: #3. Log Your Meals
option.Dics: Logging what you eat and drink will help to control calorie intake and not exceed your daily limit.

option.title: #4. Plan Meals and Shopping Lists In Advance
option.Dics: Having a strict plan makes it easier to follow a healthy diet and not to get tempted by a donut in the supermarket.

option.title: #5. Eat More Fruits and Vegetables
option.Dics: Fruits and vegetables are a great source of vitamins and minerals. Moreover, veggies are fiber-rich which helps to support healthy digestion.'s recommended to add veggies toevery meal you have during a day.

option.title: #6. Weigh Yourself Regularly
option.Dics: Weighing yourself regularly helps to monitor your weight loss progress.However, we don't recommend weighing yourself daily as water fluctuations may influence your weight and provide you with a wrong picture.Weighing yourself once a week at the same time is the best option.

option.title: #7. Drink More Water
option.Dics: Sufficient amount of water can help to burn more calories and suppress appetite.Also, drinking enough water actually helps reduce swelling or edema. If you don't get enough water, your body holds onto the fluid it has.

option.title: #8. Avoid Processed Foods
option.Dics: Processed food usually contains more calories, sodium, fat, and refined sugars than your home-made meals.Also, processed foods are usually low in essential nutrients. Thus, you consume a lot of calories but don't get essential micronutrients and vitamins.

option.title: #9. Limit Added Sugar Intake
option.Dics: Food with added sugar is, as a rule,very high in calories. So, it's easy to exceed your ideal daily intake of calories.Moreover, eating a lot of sugar is associated with a lot of diseases, such as obesity or type 2 diabetes.

option.title: #10. Sleep 7-9 Hours a Day
option.Dics: Not enough sleep can encourage overeating and increase fast food cravings.Research shows when dieters cut back on sleep over a 14-day period, the amount of weight they lost from fat dropped by 55%, even though their calories stayed equal.Thus, it's essential to give your body enough time to rest.

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: It seems like it's all about balance, right? And that includes having a calorie balance, which is a balance between the calories that youconsume and burn.

option.title: How Can You Determine Yours?
option.Dics: You should monitor your body weight and then step by step adjust your calorie intake and expenditure based on weight shifts over time.

option.title: Number of calories you need is based on:
option.Dics: • Age• Weight• Height• Basal metabolic rate • Daily activity• Other factors that may be affecting your calorie intake, like pregnancy, or being aprofessional athlete

option.title: In general, per day your body needs:

option.title: Closing Remarks
option.Dics: Maintaining a calorie balance can become one of your tools for weight management. Every health organization encourages you to reach your healthy body weight. So do we.

healthy weight.title: are zero calorie drink safe for weight loss?

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: At the moment, there is no categorical opinion about the absolute negative or positive effect of calorie-free soda on the process of weight loss.

option.title: Why Zero-Calorie Drinks Might Not Be Good for Weight Loss
option.Dics: • Usually, sweet-tasting foods bring a feeling of satiety as a result of calorie intake. But there are no calories in these beverages, so this connection weakens, and a person is getting attracted to sweets even more. • Calorie-free soda increases insulin resistance and decreases glucose tolerance, which can lead to weight gain again. • Leptin level (a hormone responsible for satiety) drops, which worsens satiety.

option.title: Bottom Line
option.Dics: In any case, there are studies that, on the contrary, demonstrate the absence of any negative effect of colorless soda on the process of losing weight, or even show its benefits.

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: Carb cycling means that people are going back and forth between high-carb and low-carb days. Its a diet in which people eat more or fewer carbohydrates on alternate days.

option.title: How Does It Work?
option.Dics: Carb cycling is based on the idea that your body uses fat as a primary fuel source when it doesn't get enough carbs. This process can aid with weight loss, body fat decrease, and effective carb storage when carbs are reintroduced.

option.title: Plan Your Carbs Ahead
option.Dics: The theory is that if you plan ahead your time when and how you eat carbs, you can get more out of your exercises and improve your performance and body composition.

option.title: Benefits
option.Dics: Carb cycling may provide several advantages, including: • Weight loss • Improved sports performance • Management of chronic disease symptoms

option.title: Exercise and Carb Cycling
option.Dics: Carb cycling is usually based on a personal training plan. People will take more carbohydrates on days when they exercise harder, whereas low-carb days will occur on days when their training is less extreme. Throughout the week, you can have numerous high-carb, medium-carb, and low-carb days.

option.title: When to Eat Carbs?
option.Dics: When you plan on doing a lot of exercises, you'll likely have a high-carb day. Because your body requires extra fuel on those days, you may consume 2 to 2.5 grams of carbohydrates per pound of body weight.

option.title: How to Do Carb Cycling?
option.Dics: • First and foremost, keep track of your macros using an app or a meal log. • Determine how many grams of carbs you should consume each day. • On high-carbohydrate days, try to take 60% of your calories from complex carbohydrates. • On low-carb days, replace part of carbs with healthful fats and high-protein products.

option.title: Bottom Line
option.Dics: Always consult your doctor before trying a new eating regimen, especially if you have some health issues.

healthy weight.title: what is fat fasting and how does it work

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: The fat fasting diet is a short-term keto method for people who want to lose weight quickly. You can lose 2-3.5 kg in a pretty short time, about 5 days.

option.title: Who Is This Method For?
option.Dics: This technique is intended for those who: • want to prevent expected weight gain after consuming a lot of food for several days in a row: • have hit a weight loss plateau and want to revamp their weight loss efforts.Fat fasting is also widely used by people who follow the ketogenic diet and have hit a plateau with their results.

option.title: Goal of Fat Fasting
option.Dics: The goal of the diet is to put the body into a state of ketosis, in which fatty acids in the body are converted by the liver into ketones, which are an alternative source of energy instead of glucose or carbohydrates. Most of the foods allowed in this diet are extremely fatty, and fat is very filling. We eat less when we eat fatty foods. This is why this diet works.

option.title: Lean On Fatty Products
option.Dics: The concept is that you get about 80-90% of your calories from fat while keeping your calorie intake low, around 1000-1200 kcal per day. Moreover, you need to keep the number of carbs at a minimum, less than 5%, and protein, less than 20%.

option.title: Risks of Fat Fasting
option.Dics: However, if you stick to fat fasting for more than five days in a row, you may force your body to starve, resulting in muscle contraction and essential nutrient deficiencies.

option.title: Is It Healthy In The Longterm?
option.Dics: This diet is still poorly understood. But obviously, this method doesn't seem really healthy as a long-term plan.There are many noticed side effects such as headaches, diarrhea, fatigue, and others. At the same time, fat fasting gives a good weight loss result in the short term.

option.title: Bottom Line
option.Dics: If you understand your goals, try fat fasting, but do it right. Make sure this diet is right for your body. Also, consult your doctor if you have any health issues.

healthy weight.title: what to eat on fat food

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: Fat fasting is a short-term, high-fat, low-carb meal plan that lasts just 3-5 days. During a fat fasting you literally should consume only fat.

option.title: Make It Effective
option.Dics: To make fat fasting work, you need to follow these rules:• Calorie intake should be in the range of 1000-1200. • Have 4-5 small meals.All foods should be high in fat, low in carbohydrates and proteins. You should aim for 80-90% of calories from fat.

option.title: What Can You Eat?
option.Dics: Generally, the list of products includes:• High-fat fish (salmon, tuna, sardines,mackerel, herring) • Nuts and coconut • Eggs • Butter (peanut), oils (coconut, olive,avocado, macadamia), spreads, mayonnaise, ghee Calorie-free beverages (water, tea, coffee,sparkling water) • High-fat, non dairy products as full-fat coconut milk and coconut cream • Low-carb vegetables (leafy greens, broccoli, brussels sprouts, zucchini, spinach, olives and other non-starchyveggies) and high-fat fruits (avocado) • Herbs and spices

option.title: Food to Avoid of Fat Fasting
option.Dics: These are the products not worth eating on this diet:• Low-fat meats (chicken, beef, lamb) and fish (cod) • Cereals and grains • Beans • Most fruits and vegetables, especially starchy Processed, packaged foods (cereal,cookies) • Cakes and sweets • Sugary beverages (juice, energy drinks,sweetened coffee) • Low-fat dairy foods

option.title: Example of Daily Menu
option.Dics: With such a high-fat diet, your daily ration may consist of:• coffee with coconut milk (94% fat, 112 kcal): • 60g of macadamia nuts (93% fat, 406kcal); • almon with buttered spinach (789) topped with a small salmon fillet (125g) cooked on butter and topped with home-made pesto (79% fat, 639 kcal).

option.title: Bottom Line
option.Dics: Now you know what to eat on a Fat Fast. Listen to your body to understand whether this method suits you!

healthy movement.title: which fasting zone is the best for excercising?

option.title: Fasting and Exercising: Can You Do Both?
option.Dics: With intermittent fasting, you have windows when you can eat and windows that you should fast. But does it mean you should give up exercising? Well, not really. Even though food is essential for giving you energy, you can exercise even when fasting. But what time during your window should you work out? Is there a common standard you should follow?

option.title: Everyone Is Unique
option.Dics: First to note is that no one way works for everyone. Every person has a different rhythm and habits, and when a slight change in daily life occurs, it may affect your performance.

option.title: Workout Before Fasting
option.Dics: However, if you are one of the people who like to work out fueled, then exercising before fasting is the most suitable time for you.This won't affect your energy, and you will avoid the muscle-burning effect that can occur due to a calorie deficiency.

option.title: Workout During Fasting
option.Dics: If you like to work out on an empty stomach, then you've just found your workout time window. One thing to pay attention to is your energy level. Whether you follow the pattern for a long time or are just getting started, be careful when you are getting your daily dose of workout.

option.title: Workout During Fasting
option.Dics: Continued fasting may lead to a drop in energy, and high-intensity workouts might not be the best program to start with. Listen to your body, and don't put too much pressure on it. Start with walking or non-intense biking or elliptical training, and then increase intensity of exercises as tolerated.

option.title: Workout After Fasting
option.Dics: Working out after fasting can help you burn additional fat, as your body is low on glucose and adapts to using fat for fuel.

option.title: Final Thoughts
option.Dics: Maintain balance in your body. If you don't feel fresh and energized enough, just skip the workout or change the window.Keep an eye on the signs your body sends and if something is wrong, change the way you do it.Always stay hydrated so that you do not fall into a double deficit and harm your health.

healthy movement.title: can your work out right after fasting ?

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: So you are fasting, and the question on your mind is:Can I work out right after fasting?While this is entirely possible, it depends on your abilities, some things are good to know. And here they are.

option.title: 1#. Fasting & Weight Loss
option.Dics: Fasting is known to promote weight loss because it creates a calorie deficiency and lowers your insulin levels. Adding exercise to that should further enhance the effect because the body will use fat as energy. That's why you may lose weight more quickly.But does this have any side effects?

option.title: #2. Affected Performance
option.Dics: When training right after fasting, you may notice a worsened physical performance or the inability to work out as long as you usually do due to lack of energy. On the other hand, you may have a boost in energy from fasting. This mostly depends on how long you have been practicing intermittent fasting.

option.title: #3. Fasting & Muscle Gain
option.Dics: If you are trying to build muscle mass, working out right after fasting may not be ideal. Simply workout during your eating window and make sure you are getting enough calories through nutrient dense foods. Your body won't break down muscle for energy unless you have been fasting for at least 24 hours.

option.title: #4. Listen to Your Body
option.Dics: If you like to work out on an empty stomach and this is something normal for you, fasting should not affect you much.But if you aren't used to this, you may feel dizzy, tired as there will be a drop in your blood sugar levels.

option.title: #5. Try Low-intensity Workouts
option.Dics: In order to not put a lot of pressure on your body, consider more low-intensity workouts like walking, yoga and pilates. It will help you avoid getting tired quickly until you have adjusted to intermittent fasting.

option.title: Bottom Line
option.Dics: Fasting doesn't mean that you need to stop working out. Adjust your training to your body needs to make it comfortable personally for you.

healthy movement.title: when should you eat:before or after a walk?

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: Let's be honest, weight loss rarely happens without physical exercise. However, for some, starting to exercise is a big change to their daily routine.

The good news is that you don't need to sign up for a year's membership at the gym right away. Seriously, do you know anyone who has used their yearly membership? We mean someone who's used it entirely. That's what we thought...

option.title: Have You thought About Walking?
option.Dics: It is the easiest way to start being physically active. You don't need to buy any special clothes or gear, just put on your regular comfortable clothes and shoes and you're ready to go.But what about food - should you do anything different?

option.title: Walking After Meals
option.Dics: • A small study showed that having a meal right before going for a 30-minute walk can be beneficial for weight loss • Light to moderate activity after meals can boost your metabolism • Eating before walking may also aid insomnia (HUH?)-never heard that • It can improve your digestion

option.title: Walking After Meals
option.Dics: • Walking Before Meals • Walking prior to meals can help reduce your appetite, and eventually your food intake • It can amplify your body's metabolism • A walk in a fasting state helps your body burn more fat.

option.title: Closing Remarks
option.Dics: Anyway, you have to choose the option that is comfortable for you. Just don't forget to drink water during and after walking!

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: We have outlined 12 everyday movements to start your transition to living a healthier life. The exercises are shown in increasing difficulty. You can combine the exercises to give yourself a bigger challenge.

option.title: Exercise 1- Planks
option.Dics: The plank is a brilliant exercise for anyone to do. Its main principle is to keep your body still under an isometric hold. The primary muscles that will work are your core and abs.

option.title: Exercise 2 -10k Steps Daily
option.Dics: At the usual walking pace,10,000 steps take around 45 minutes -1 hour. If 10,000 steps are too much, then reduce it to 7,500. If 10k is not enough then, increase to 15 or 20k.

option.title: Exercise 3 - Crunches
option.Dics: This exercise, much like the plank, is beneficial for the core. The main difference here is you are curling your upper body towards your knees. This exercise will shift focus more on the upper abs

option.title: Exercise 4 - Push-Ups
option.Dics: This exercise is one of the best anyone can do daily, especially at home during the lockdown. This movement corporates the pushing muscles of the upper body (shoulders, chest, and triceps).

option.title: Exercise 5 - Jumping Jacks
option.Dics: This exercise is a great high-intensity cardio movement. Nearly all muscles in your body are incorporated. This exercise can be reasonably difficult, so don't try to push yourself too hard.

option.title: Exercise 6 - Squats + Push-Ups
option.Dics: This exercise is a combination of two separate pushing movements. Together, they hit the upper and lower body.

option.title: Exercise 7 - Jumping Rope
option.Dics: This exercise is one of the best ways to burn calories quickly. Jumping rope involves a lot of muscles, which is why you can burn so many calories.

option.title: Exercise 8 - Jump Squats
option.Dics: This exercise is a great high-intensity cardio workout. You will burn a lot of calories in a short amount of time. Try doing four sets of 12-15 reps. Keep the rest low at 1 minute between each set.

option.title: Exercise 9 - Burpees
option.Dics: This exercise is also great for cardio. You can burn lots of calories since nearly all the muscles are involved in the movement. Try to do as many reps as you can within 1 minute.

option.title: Exercise 10 - Yoga Sun Salutation
option.Dics: This movement is a series of yoga positions that are to be performed in a specific order. Yoga is a great way to understand how well you can control your body since you will need to hold these positions for quite some time.

option.title: Exercise 11- Plank + Burpees
option.Dics: The best way to do this combination is to do 1 set of planks and go straight into 1 set of burpees. Do this cycle four times to really get a great workout. One set of planks should last 45 seconds, and 1 set of burpees should consist of 12-15 reps.

option.title: Exercise 12 - 3km Run
option.Dics: The final exercise is the most difficult, but if done daily can show great results. Running is already a great cardiovascular exercise. Keep in mind that you should run at a comfortable pace.

option.title: Closing Remarks
option.Dics: You don't have to do all these exercises daily for 30 days but doing a combination or even one can help you become more fit. Remember, set a goal that is realistic. Give yourself a very achievable target by the end of 30 days.

option.title: Introduction
option.Dics: Running during fasting is called fasted running. As we know, the human body is dependent on carbohydrates to produce energy. However, during prolonged fasting, no reserved glycogen is available. Thus we switch to fat reserves to get energy.Can you run during fasting? Yes, you can. But always check and pay attention to your health conditions, fitness level, goals, and medical history.

option.title: Health Conditions
option.Dics: Fasted running depends on your health conditions because blood glucose and insulin levels go down while cortisol (stress) hormone increases. Running during fasting is not recommended for those who suffer from type 1 or 2 diabetes, hypoglycemia, Addison's disease and some other conditions.

Fasted Running Reduces Training Intensity After an overnight fast, your body starts mobilizing fat for fuel. However, it's not the preferred fuel source for our bodies, so it can cause fatigue which in turn increases risk of injury.
Does Fasted Running Induce Fat Burning? Yes, fasted cardio directly targets your stored fat for energy as there is no glucose left to be used.

option.title: More Weight Loss Compared to Non-fasted Running?
option.Dics: You won't burn more calories compared to non-fasted cardio. However, as you're already low on carbs, your body will kick in more stored fats for energy.So, you will burn more fat. However, it won't necessarily result in higher weight loss. The number on scales itself is not enough to judge your health state.

option.title: Does Fasted Running Improve Performance?
option.Dics: High-intensity workouts will more likely improve your fitness performance, which is not possible in a fasted state due to low blood glucose levels.

option.title: Benefits of Fasted Running It you practice fasted running, you can: -
option.Dics: convert fat to fuel for body - burn fat even after exercising - reduce insulin levels

option.title: Is Prolonged Fasted Running Good?
option.Dics: If you have too much fasted running, you might notice several cons like: • Prolonged muscle recovery after exercise • Reduced performance at higher intensities and race pace • Lower carbohydrate metabolism • Weaker immune system • Reduced muscle mass • Imbalance in menstrual cycle for women -this is serious and should be discussed with your doctor.

option.title: Bottom Line
option.Dics: Be mindful of your health conditions and lifestyle to determine whether fasted running suits you or not.And always remember that moderation is the key.

healthy movement.title: 7 way yoga can help you reduce stress

option.title: It Lowers Cortisol and Adrenaline Levels
option.Dics: Harvard Medical School has proved that yoga suppresses cortisol levels, which is the primary stress hormone. It also lowers adrenaline, which raises your heartbeat and elevates blood pressure

option.title: It Strengthens Muscles
option.Dics: The best poses to stimulate muscle building are the tree pose, warrior three, bridge pose, and chair pose. Hatha Yoga has proved beneficial in intensifying body flexibility and improving a range of body

option.title: It Increases Self-Awareness
option.Dics: Research by the NCBI says that yoga promotes personal health, self-awareness, and mental wellbeing, all of which are essential aspects of life.

option.title: It Eases Breathing
option.Dics: Pranayama yoga involves three breathing practices: relaxed inhale, diaphragmatic breathing, and gentle extended exhale. It draws in tranquility, lowering your breathing rate by relaxing your mind.

option.title: The Final Takeaway
option.Dics: Yoga helps you stay in shape both mentally and physically. It works on the concepts of mindfulness and living in the moment. It is an antidote to stress because it eases your mind silently.

healthy movement.title: walkinhg :easy way to stay active during

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: For those who have been hesitant to exercise while fasting, the good news is that it is perfectly healthy to do so, as long as you are careful. Fasting and exercising can be combined without causing harm to the body.

option.title: Is It Possible to Exercise While Fasting?
option.Dics: Yes! You get a rise in growth hormone and become more insulin sensitive, which is crucial for staying in shape.

option.title: What Kind of Workouts Should You Do?
option.Dics: Exercises that raise your pulse rate above 150 beats per minute should be avoided if you haven't broken your fast yet. Exercises that are gradual or moderate are recommended. During fasting, experts recommend a brisk walk, jogging, cycling, and light machine activities at the gym.

option.title: How Much to Walk During Fasting?
option.Dics: We recommend walking about 30 minutes a day, five times a week. Start small and gradually increase the distance when you feel that you can manage to do it.
Is It Possible to Walk on an Empty Stomach? Exercising on an empty stomach is perfectly acceptable.

option.title: Risks of Walking on Empty Stomach
option.Dics: You might feel more tired, have less stamina, however, this is not likely. Also, your body might adjust to continually using fat for energy and then start storing it more than usual.

option.title: Main Takeaways
option.Dics: - Walking while fasting is perfectly acceptable. - Combining working out and intermittent fasting can optimize benefits. - You can do cardio walking during fasting, although your performance may suffer slightly.

option.title: Main Takeaways
option.Dics: The optimal time to walk while fasting is early in the day to follow the body's natural circadian rhythm.Don't put too much pressure on yourself. Exercise lightly not to feel fatigued due to lowered blood sugar levels.

healthy movement.title: can you work out during fasting

option.title: Can You Work Out During Fasting?
option.Dics: If you are an intermittent fasting novice, you may have questions, and you may find that Can I exercise while fasting? is one of them.

option.title: Maybe, Better to Miss?
option.Dics: It's a matter of logic. Fuel is necessary, and your energy resources seem to be quickly depleted.So, maybe you think it's better to skip your workout Not that quickly. You can profoundly influence your health if you plan physical exercise into your lifestyle. Here are some reasons

option.title: Reason #1
option.Dics: Testosterone increases the potential for weight reduction and improves fat oxidation. By the way, not only men need testosterone.It also reduces blood sugar and boosts the synthesis of human growth hormone in your body.

option.title: Reason #2
option.Dics: Fasting lowers insulin levels. This hormone lowers blood sugar if needed. So, you start burning fat for fuel, instead of glucose.If your blood sugar levels are excessively high, it results in increased fat storage. Your body stores sugar as fat when you eat it inexcess.

option.title: Resistance to Insulin
option.Dics: Low sensitivity to insulin or resistance to insulin is an issue for one out of three Americans.It implies your body is left with extra glucose that it either stores in your liver as glycogen or stores it as fat.

option.title: Reason #3
option.Dics: You can exercise in a fasted state but you should not exceed more than 60 minutes of exercise before eating and it should not be high intensity.However, there is no recent evidence for this.

option.title: Some Safety Tips
option.Dics: Please get familiar with the fasting routine before adding exercise to your program.If you leap into excessive physical activity, blood sugar can lower, and you will experience weakness, dizziness, brain fog or other negative effects.

option.title: Don't Forget to Hydrate
option.Dics: Remember that it's easy to become dehydrated when you fast.Dehydration is much more common when you add physical exertion to the situation. Drink more water.

option.title: Conclusion
option.Dics: Is it possible to work out when fasting? Yes, but pay attention to your body and use caution.

healthy movement.title: run and loss weight using these 10 rules

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: We all know that running and even walking is a great way to burn fat and calories. Out of all the cardiovascular movements, running is amongst the best as it can build muscle too.But how to make running as effective as possible?

option.title: 1. Clean Up Your Diet
option.Dics: Calculate a calorie deficit: Number of Calories Consumed - Calories Burnt Per Day = Calories You Need to Burn by Exercising If you are in a calorie deficit of 500 calories, you can expect to lose 1lb each week.

option.title: 2. Make Workouts Challenging
option.Dics: One way you can do this is by doing a HIIT workout. You can run at a steady pace for 1 minute, then sprint full speed for 30 seconds, then back to the run. Do it 20 times, and that would be your cardio.

option.title: 3. Go Easy on Yourself
option.Dics: Making it challenging is considerable for adding variety and even cutting the total amount of time you run, but making them too hard can be detrimental.

option.title: 4. Chase the Runner's High
option.Dics: Just after you finish your running session, you may feel a surge of happiness and euphoria fuelled by a rush of endorphins. This feeling is your reward for the work you just did.

option.title: 5. Stay Hydrated
option.Dics: You need to drink water to keep your muscles hydrated and stop them from fatiguing too early. It means if you drink more water, you'll run longer, banishing more calories.

option.title: 6. Get Sufficient Sleep
option.Dics: Your muscles and joints need time to recover. The only time we recover is during our sleep, so you must get 7-9 hours of sleep every day.

option.title: 7. Avoid Exertion
option.Dics: You need to make sure that you don't overwork your body. If you don't give your muscles enough downtime, you are increasing the chances of getting an injury. If you are new to running, make sure you listen to your body.

option.title: 8. Don't Skip Weight Training
option.Dics: Your legs and calves are used in the movement, and if you train them outside of running, you can expect to see an increase in your running ability. Also, safe weight training can improve the stability and longevity of your joints.

option.title: 9. Don't Quit
option.Dics: The most important part about running or any other workout is consistency. You won't see results from running if you do it just for a couple of days. You must push through, and that is when you will see the result.

option.title: 10. Progressive Overload
option.Dics: Once you've created a program and got stuck to it, you have to make sure that you intensify your exercises. To increase your strength in running, you have to make the movement more challenging.

healthy movement.title: hiit and fasting can they co exist

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: You did high-intensity workouts to lose extra pounds and fat, but now you're practicing intermittent fasting. So what now?Can intermittent fasting and highintensity workouts be combined without any side effects?Let's take a look...

option.title: HIIT Workout Benefits
option.Dics: HIIT has not only a weight loss effect but also other health benefits. You can let off steam and sometimes even instantly improve your mood.Moreover, high-intensity workouts are beneficial for many other reasons such as increasing endurance and improving cardiovascular health.

option.title: What Happens When You Combine HIIT with Fasting?
option.Dics: Well, you may experience a drop in performance, but you most likely will not. You may experience some side effects like dizziness, fatigue, and headache and can experience reverse effect and feel more energized, having more productive workouts.

option.title: Best Time to Do HIIT
option.Dics: During high-intensity training gets your body moving and blood pumping.Therefore, exercise in the morning can stimulate your natural rhythm and boost your mood for the day.You might want to avoid HIIT near the bedtime hours, because it may influence your sleep and interrupt levels of deep and REM sleep.

option.title: What Else Should You Know?
option.Dics: When you combine intermittent fasting and high-intensity training you'll want to make sure that you are eating nutrient-dense food during your eating window. If you choose 16:8, you have 8 hours to fuel your body and be ready for your workouts.

option.title: Who Should Be Careful
option.Dics: Please avoid HIIT and fasting if you are pregnant or you have some type of eating disorder. This might lead to intaking fewer nutrients than you need, and negatively affect your health.If you have any other health issues, we advise you to consult your doctor for further guidelines.

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: We agree that a healthy diet is the key to weight loss. But adding physical activity can boost your calorie burn!

option.title: Long Walks
option.Dics: If you are just starting your weight loss journey, try not to over-do the exercise part. Start with long walks till you get used to moving every day.

option.title: Riding a Bike
option.Dics: This will not only promote losing weight, but it will tone your muscles. Find a nice park with a pretty view and give it a try!

option.title: swiming
option.Dics: An hour in the swimming pool can burn up to 900 calories! It also won't be a burden to your joints

option.title: yoga
option.Dics: If you would like to start easier, try yoga for weight loss. It can strengthen your body and make you crazy flexible.

option.title: dancing
option.Dics: There is no better option for combining business and pleasure than dancing. While enjoying your favorite music, you can burn fat and have an amazingly fun time alone at home or with your friends.

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: If you are one of those people who like to slow down the pace during a workout and enjoy something light that will keep your body in shape, no matter if you are at home, in the gym, or with a friend Then these five low-intensity training ideas are for you.

option.title: #1. Walking
option.Dics: Yes, this also counts as a workout!You are able to burn the same amount of calories as in the gym while enjoying some light walking, depending on how far you walk. If you enjoy going to the gym and you're looking for some kind of uplift, then try the treadmill or the stepper machine.

option.title: walking outside
option.Dics: For those who love to spend time outside or you just want to try something new, walk in the park, or organize some hiking with friends. Make your walking workout refreshing and recharging!

option.title: #2. Cycling
option.Dics: We all know professional cyclists or fitness enthusiasts who use cycling as cardio. But that may not necessarily be the case for you!You can ride a bike for work (which will not only provide you with a daily dose of exercise but can also reduce your transportation costs) or simply ride to enjoy some time outside.

option.title: #3. Jogging
option.Dics: It's a great way to get your daily dose of workout while moving your body, getting some fresh air, taking care of yourself with lower fatigue rates than the usual fast paced running.You can also do some stretching after jogging at a favorite spot with a view and have fun!

option.title: #4. Swimming
option.Dics: Okay, that may not be for everyone. But if you like swimming you can practice both during summer in the sea, lake or outdoor pool and, in the winter, in the indoor swimming pool.Doing exercises in the water has a lot of benefits for your body. Plus, it may heal some past injuries while giving a more pressure-free environment for moving. You can also practice swimming as a recovery.

option.title: #5. Yoga
option.Dics: Forget about the myths that yoga is only for flexible people. Yes, it's true that there are different levels for beginners and advanced, but you are free to choose the one that suits your physical ability.Yoga is for everyone, so choose your level and enjoy the practice.

healthy movement.title: 7 tips to take more steps daily

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: Did you notice that when you take frequent walks, you are in a better mood and feel more energetic than if you sit all day in front of a TV?That's because including more steps in your day has a lot of benefits for your health, especially for your cardiovascular system.Here are some ways how you can increase the steps during your day.

option.title: Set Daily Goals
option.Dics: For sure, it will be challenging to take 20,000 steps in one breath. And you don't have to do it. Take steps throughout your day.Start with a small number and slowly increase by 200 steps per day or use the time as your metric.For example, walk 5 minutes today, and tomorrow take a 7-minute walk. Upgrade step by step and make itfun.

option.title: Explore New Places
option.Dics: One of the most entertaining things about walking is finding new routes.Go to a new park and explore it. It's an easy way to boost the number of steps you take daily.

option.title: Make It a Habit
option.Dics: Creating habits is challenging. But it will help you to make walking a part of your daily routine.To make walking a solid habit, it's better to connect your new routine to the daily actions you already have. For example, take a 5-minute walk after breakfast. As you have breakfast every day, it will be easy not to miss it.

option.title: Set Reminders
option.Dics: If you are worried about forgetting to take a walk, you can set reminders during the day and gradually build new healthy habits.

option.title: Walk During Talking on the Phone
option.Dics: Do you walk around the room while you are on your phone?If so, this is an easy way to take more steps! While talking on the phone or during a work call, do some housework or make a few rounds in the room. Distracted by something else, you can quickly add 200 steps to your counter!

option.title: Choose Walking Instead of a Car
option.Dics: Often to get to the store you may need to travel by car. However, you can go out 30 minutes earlier and get there on foot if you have time.If you can't totally refuse to use your car, park your car further from the entrance. It may sound insignificant, but these little things pile up, and you will feel the difference!

option.title: Take the Stairs
option.Dics: People got used to taking elevators to get around. It is certainly much easier when the buildings are high. But you can challenge yourself!Choose the stairs. Not only will you do a quick workout, but you will contribute to a greener planet.

option.title: Get a Pet That Loves Walking
option.Dics: Having a pet like a dog that needs a walk will encourage you to be more active. So you can easily walk around the park and add extra steps for the day.

option.title: Bottom Line

option.title: Choose Your Ideal Fasting Cycle
option.Dics: Start with a less intense fasting regimen, then increase the duration and intensity when you feel comfortable. Consider gradually expanding your fasting window while reducing an eating one.

option.title: Debunking the Myths
option.Dics: Despite what you've heard, your eating window is not your opportunity to eat whatever you want. It would be best if you still tried to follow a well-balanced and nourishing diet with various whole foods.

option.title: Debunking the Myths
option.Dics: Even though you can work out when fasting, try to focus on lower-intensity exercises and schedule them at times that allow you to replenish your body adequately, such as pre and post-workout.

option.title: Listen to Your Body
option.Dics: Experiencing hunger and fatigue is very common, especially in the beginning. If you feel sick or just not quite right at any point in this process, listen to your body and break your fast.

option.title: Beginner's Tips for Success
option.Dics: s 1. Stay hydrated! 2. Eat a balanced, nutrient-dense diet. 3. Get adequate sleep, so your mind and body are well-rested. 4. Consult with your doctor or dietitian before starting any new eating regimen.

option.title: Staying Hydrated, Staying Healthy
option.Dics: About 3/4th of our body is made of water. Keeping your body hydrated allows it to function properly, from regulating body temperature to protecting our tissues and joints. We all need water to survive!

option.title: Warning Signs of Dehydration
option.Dics: 1. Urine is a dark, concentrated yellow color 2. Headache 3. Dry mouth or lips 4. Dizziness or lightheadedness 5. Weakness or lethargy

option.title: Dangers of Dehydration
option.Dics: If you stay dehydrated for a long time, it can lead to potentially serious problems:1. Kidney dysfunction 2. Seizures 3. Heat stroke 4. Low blood volume

option.title: Benefits of Adequate Hydration
option.Dics: 1. It improves energy levels and brain function 2. It maximizes physical fitness and performance 3. It improves bowel regularity and promotes healthy digestion 4. It helps your body efficiently remove waste products

option.title: Estimating Your Fluid Requirements
option.Dics: Experts recommend about 11 cups per day for women and 16 cups per day for men. For most healthy adults, drinking 30-35 ml per kg of body weight is perfect.

option.title: Tips to Drink More Water
option.Dics: 1. Carry a water bottle with you. 2. Choose plain water or fruit-infused water over sugary beverages.3. Eat more fruits and vegetables, which naturally contain water.4. Set reminders on your phone.

option.title: Breaking Your Fast
option.Dics: Remember to create a plan for meals and snacks ahead of time, so you're prepared. Planning and preparation are crucial to preventing overeating and making poor food choices.

option.title: Ease Back Into Eating
option.Dics: Ease back into eating to allow your digestive system to adjust. If you break your fast with a large meal and hard-to-digest foods, you may have unpleasant digestive issues. Start with small servings.

option.title: Balanced and Complete Meals
option.Dics: A balanced meal is made up of carbohydrates, fat, and protein. To properly nourish your body and increase feelings of fullness, we need each of these macronutrients in our eating pattern.

option.title: Examples of Healthy Meals
option.Dics: Complex carbs: fruit, whole grains, and sweet potatoes.Healthy proteins: tofu, nuts, and beans. Healthy fats: avocado, olive oil, nuts, and seeds.

option.title: Add Fiber
option.Dics: Fiber not only promotes healthy digestion but also can increase fullness. High fiber foods include oatmeal, oat bran, nuts, seeds, popcorn, beans, whole fruit, and vegetables.

option.title: Focus On Nutrient-dense and Whole Foods
option.Dics: Avoid processed foods and aim to consume mostly whole, real, and minimally-processed foods.

option.title: Does Intermittent Fasting Work for Weight Loss?
option.Dics: Restricting your eating window indeed decreases your total calorie intake, which may promote weight loss. Also, there are different phases your body goes through while fasting, and this may also play its role in weight loss.

option.title: Different Phases in the Fasting Process
option.Dics: When engaging in fasting practices, your body moves through various phases due to changes in metabolism and hormone levels but keep in mind that everyone responds to fasting differently.

option.title: Blood Glucose and Insulin Levels Drop
option.Dics: Glucose, or sugar, is absorbed into the bloodstream with the help of insulin for energy or stored for future use. Decreased levels of insulin may increase the burning of fat.

option.title: Free Fatty Acids Increase
option.Dics: Once your body has used up the stored glucose for energy, free fatty acids become the primary fuel source. The exact time your body makes this shift depends on how much glucose you have stored.

option.title: And Now You Are Entering Ketosis
option.Dics: At this point, some of these free fatty acids turn into ketones in the liver, indicating that you've entered the metabolic state called ketosis, where your body begins to break down fat.

option.title: Factors Impacting Your Weight
option.Dics: Many factors can cause daily weight fluctuations, such as hydration status, bowel movements, the time of day, and the type of food consumed (e.g., eating salty foods may cause your body to retain water).

option.title: Other Ways to Measure Success Without Stepping on the Scales
option.Dics: Your weight is not the sole indicator of your worth or health. You can measure your progress without stepping on the scales by evaluating your energy levels, physical fitness, performance, and general appearance.

option.title: Reasons to Track Your Weight
option.Dics: Tracking your weight regularly shows whether you're making desirable progress. It is recommended to check your weight once a week, at the same time, and on the same scales.

body and mind.title: insulin drop: what happens to our body

option.title: introduction
option.Dics: Insulin is an essential hormone that transports glucose from the bloodstream to the cells. Glucose is the primary source of energy for your body. And insulin works to maintain healthy blood sugar levels. Glucose levels that are too high or too low might result in significant health issues.

option.title: Insulin and Fasting
option.Dics: After the fast, you have low insulin levels as you haven't eaten for a while. Usually, when insulin is low, blood sugar rises.However, studies suggest that fasting can help to reduce insulin resistance without altering blood sugar levels.

option.title: How Does Insulin Work?
option.Dics: Insulin works together with another hormone generated by the pancreas, glucagon. While insulin's job is to reduce blood sugar levels when they're too high, glucagon's job is to raise them when they're too low.The body uses this system to keep blood glucose levels within optimal ranges, allowing the body to operate normally.

option.title: Insulin Drops: What Happens?
option.Dics: When the body produces insufficient insulin, it cannot transport glucose from the bloodstream into the cells, resulting in excessive blood glucose levels. Excess glucose overflows into the urine if the glucose level is high enough. This may cause more frequent urination and thirst. Also, dehydration may appear. That's why it's essential to drink enough water during fasting.

option.title: Can Insulin Drop Be Good?
option.Dics: Insulin drops are not always bad. During intermittent fasting, when you are not eating, your body has time to lower insulin levels.Lower insulin levels can help you use your body fat as an energy source. So, you can lose more weight and fat, in particular

option.title: What Can You Experience with Low Insulin Levels
option.Dics: People with high blood sugar as a result of constant low insulin levels tend to experience rapid heartbeat, vomiting, excessive hunger and thirst.

option.title: Insulin Drops and Diabetes
option.Dics: Constant low insulin levels and insulin resistance may result in diabetes. People with Type 1 Diabetes are considered insulin deficient because they do not produce any insulin. People with Type 2 Diabetes may still produce insulin however, may also develop insulin resistance.

option.title: Possible Consequences
option.Dics: Furthermore, when there is insufficient insulin, the cells cannot utilize glucose for energy, necessitating the use of alternative energy sources (such as fat and muscle). Overtime, This exhausts the body and leads to the progressive breakdown of proteins as effective fat stores are depleted resulting in muscle wasting.Hyperglycemia (excess glucose in the blood) may even lead to consequences such as nerve damage (neuropathy), kidney damage, and eye difficulties.

option.title: Bottom Line
option.Dics: After fasting, your insulin levels drop. But it's an absolutely normal healthy body process. It is not the same as having chronically low insulin levels. Studies show that regular intermittent fasting may help reduce insulin resistance and lower the risk of diabetes.
