option.Dics: • People who do not get much sunlight (you live in the northern part of the country or are homebound) • African-American, Hispanic, or Asian-American • Women who are postmenopausal

option.title: Who May Need It
option.Dics: • Obese people • People who have inflammatory bowel disease or any other disease that makes it harder for the gut to absorb fat (vitamin D is a fat-soluble vitamin, meaning it has to be absorbed by the gut) • People who have had gastric bypass surgery (weight loss surgery)

option.title: Consult Your Physician
option.Dics: Talk to your doctor if you think you may not get enough vitamin D. However, most women do not need testing for vitamin D deficiency.

option.title: Where to Find It in Food
option.Dics: • Fish like tuna and salmon • Fortified foods like cereals, soy beverages, fat-free milk • Orange juice • Egg yolks • Cheese

fasting challenge.title: welcome to your 30 day fasting chalenge

option.title: Welcome to Your 30-day Fasting Challenge!
option.Dics: Over the next 30 days, you will learn the basics of fasting, healthy nutrition, and exercise to move closer towards your health goals! The path ahead might seem overwhelming right now, but don't fret, we will take it one step at a time.

option.title: Welcome to Your 30-day Fasting Challenge! In Week 1
option.Dics: , you will be introduced to intermittent fasting and try fasting for the first time! In Week 2, you will learn more about nutrition. In addition to fasting, eating healthy will help you achieve your goals!

option.title: Welcome to Your 30-day Fasting Challenge! In Week 3
option.Dics: , we will be introducing more movement into your life. And Week 4 will be focused on integrating the habits you adopted during the first three weeks.

option.title: Welcome to Your 30-day Fasting Challenge!
option.Dics: We will start our challenge tomorrow. Meanwhile, take some time to explore our app and try out its features! Tip: In the My Insights menu, you will be able to find useful info on fasting and more that is tailored to your everyday tasks.

option.title: Welcome to Your 30-day Fasting Challenge!
option.Dics: The content in this challenge was reviewed by Jen Birge. She is a Registered Dietitian Nutritionist and Certified Diabetes Care and Education Specialist with 18 years of experience as a Registered Dietitian.

fasting challenge.title: day 1 intro to a fasting schedule

option.title: Day 1: Introduction to Your Intermittent Fasting Schedule
option.Dics: Welcome to the first day of your 30-day fasting challenge! Are you excited about the journey ahead? We sure are!During your first week, start by getting familiar with the basics of intermittent fasting.

option.title: Today's task: Introduction to Your Intermittent Fasting Schedule.
option.Dics: We recommend you follow a fasting schedule that is tailored to your needs and health goals. You can get familiar with it in the Timer section of the app.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Because your eating window will be shorter than usual, it's a good idea to skip one of your meals. You can decide whether it will be breakfast or dinner, either option works!Be sure to set up your fasting timer in the “Timer” section of the app to start your first fast

fasting challenge.title: day 2 learn the bsic of fasting

option.title: Day 2: Learn About the Basics of Fasting
option.Dics: Welcome back! We hope that you had a chance to try fasting yesterday for the first time. Regardless of how successful it went, we are proud of you. Taking the first step is always the hardest part!Today you will learn more about how fasting works.

option.title: Learn About the Basics of Fasting
option.Dics: When you stop eating for a long period of time, your body uses the glucose stored in the liver as glycogen to sustain your body. But after about 12 hours, the body starts to use fat for energy. That's why intermittent fasting is a good way to lose weight, especially stubborn fat!

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: To ensure your fasting journey is successful, remember these simple rules:1. Don't eat anything with calories during the fasting window (liquids that are calorie-free are ok).2. Stay hydrated during your fast.3. Break the fast with a high-nutrient meal.4. During your fasting hours, drink herbal teas or water with lemon.

option.title: Task for the Day:
option.Dics: Track Your Weight Welcome back! Today's a great day to start tracking your weight!Tracking your weight is important because it shows your progress. A change in your weight, or lack thereof, will tell you whether you should keep going or if you need to change some aspects of your daily routine.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Your weight fluctuates during the day depending on the food you're eating, amount of fluids you're consuming, bowel movements, etc. So it's important to weigh in at the same time every day, using the same scale. You can log your weight in the weight tracker in the app.It's best to weigh yourself in the morning or before your first meal!

option.title: Day 4: Stay Hydrated During Your Fast
option.Dics: How's your fasting journey going so far? Remember that it's ok if you get off track once in a while, as long as you return to the healthy habits you've started ;)

option.title: Task for the Day
option.Dics: Today we will talk about water intake.Staying hydrated is essential for anyone who wants to lead a healthy lifestyle. And it's even more important if you're fasting.

option.title: During Your Fast you Can Drink Calorie-free Beverages.
option.Dics: Some examples of such drinks:• Black coffee • Unsweetened green, black, or herbal tea • Plain water (feel free to add lemon!) • Mineral/Sparkling waterBut beware of diet drinks with artificial sweeteners. Even though they are calorie-free, they can make you crave sweet foods, so they do not help.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: To track whether you're getting enough water, log every beverage that you drink in our app.The feelings of hunger and thirst sometimes mimic each other, so try drinking some of these beverages when you're feeling hungry on a fast.

option.title: Task for the Day: Stay Active and Move Your Body
option.Dics: Hi there! Remember that success isn't about greatness, it's about consistency. Practice makes perfect!To lead a healthy lifestyle, you need to stay active as well. Going for a run or joining a fitness class is great, but even regular walking can bring you those health benefits! While you're still in the beginning of your fasting journey, try not to over-complicate your fitness routine.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: We recommend walking for around 30 minutes total each day. You can allow FastEasy access to your step tracking app in the Statistics menu to see how many steps you're taking.Schedule your daily activity ahead of time, so that you don't skip it because you're busy or just procrastinating.

option.title: Task for the Day
option.Dics: Hey there! You've made it to Day 6, so it's time to reward yourself!If you reward yourself for sticking to your fasting challenge, the journey itself will seem a lot easier. When you do something pleasant for yourself after completing a fast or exercising, your brain will associate this new habit with the reward. So sticking to the habit will become more exciting!

option.title: tips
option.Dics: You can reward yourself with anything, from having a bubble bath to buying yourself some flowers. It's best to plan the type of reward ahead of time.Ideally, the reward should be something that is a treat and makes you feel happy!

option.title: Task for the Day
option.Dics: Welcome to Day 7! It's been a whole week since we started this challenge! Yay!Today it's time to reflect on the journey so far. Just take a moment to sit and write down how you feel.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Here are some questions you can try to answer:• How do you feel after these 7 days? • What has been easier than you expected?What has been harder? • Have you noticed any changes in your energy levels or mood? Are you ready for your second week of the challenge?Reflect on your progress at the end of each week of this challenge!

fasting challenge.title: day meal plan for the next week

option.title: Welcome to Week 2!
option.Dics: This week, the focus is on adding healthy foods into your eating plan.When fasting, you don't have to follow a restrictive diet or worry about counting calories. However, if you want to lose weight and have a successful fasting journey, we suggest you eat nutrient-dense foods that promote good health.

option.title: Task for the Day:
option.Dics: Falling back into old routines is easy, so in order to stick to eating healthy, it's important to create a meal plan for the week. This way you will know what groceries to buy and if you ever feel uncertain about what to eat throughout the week, you can always consult your plan for ideas.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: You can find healthy recipe ideas in the “Insights” menu in our app.Think of your meal plan as inspiration rather than a rigid schedule.

fasting challenge.title: day 9 prepare a high protien meal

option.title: Prepare a High-protein Meal
option.Dics: Hello-hello! We understand that developing new habits is challenging. But we also know that you can achieve anything you put your mind to!With fasting, you have a shorter time period to eat but that doesn't mean you have to miss out on a balanced diet. Whether you choose to eat two meals or three smaller meals during your eating time, it's important to make sure those meals are as nutritious as possible.

option.title: Task for the Day
option.Dics: Filling up on empty calories like junk food and soda will make your fasting time harder to get through. Eating foods that are packed with healthy nutrients will help sustain you during your fasting window and make fasting easier.Let's do this step by step. Today, prepare a high-protein lunch to break your fast. You can find recipe ideas in the following Insights.

option.title: Fasting Tip:
option.Dics: It's best to break a fast with lean protein and fiber-rich foods like vegetables, fruits, legumes, and whole grains.

option.title: Task for the Day:
option.Dics: Hi there! We are 13 of the way through our journey! Keep it going;)You've probably heard different recommendations about how much water you are supposed to drink each day. Adults are recommended to drink at least 1.8-2.3 liters (64 to 80 ounces) of water per day in addition to the liquid they get from fruits, veggies, soups, and even oatmeal.

option.title: fasting tips
option.Dics: Drinking plain water is crucial for your overall health. However, the number of glasses you will need is individual to your body. For example, if you live in a dry area, you might need more water. Or if you exercise and sweat a lot, it is important to replace those fluids.We have calculated the amount of water you need to drink based on your data. Check it out in our hydration tracker and don't forget to log all your drinks!

fasting challenge.title: day 11 add fiber to your diet

option.title: Task for the Day:
option.Dics: How's this week treating you so far? We hope that it's getting easier to stick to your new routine!Today it's time to cook something high in fiber with non-starchy vegetables!

option.title: Add Fiber and Non-starchy Vegetables to Your Diet
option.Dics: Fiber is a great source of energy for fasting days because it makes you feel fuller for longer. Non-starchy vegetables are a great source of fiber, they are packed with antioxidants, and they are low in calories.Non-starchy vegetables include: artichokes, asparagus, tomatoes, broccoli, cabbage, peppers, zucchini, radishes, onions, etc.

option.title: fasting tips
option.Dics: You can also fill up on fruit, whole grains, beans, brown rice, nuts, and oatmeal. They are great sources of fiber as well!For lunch and dinner, make sure half your plate is full of vegetables.

option.title: Task for the Day:
option.Dics: Today's task is a challenging one but We believe you can stick to it, if even just for one day!Today you will try to exclude added sugar from your diet. Sugar might make food taste good but it also can lead to an array of diseases and health problems.

option.title: Exclude Added Sugar for One Day
option.Dics: Make it a habit to check the labels of the foods you consume to see if there is any added sugar. Beware of salad dressings and different sauces. Added sugar can also be listed as corn syrup, fructose, honey, rice syrup, evaporated cane juice, etc.

option.title: fasting tips
option.Dics: It's a challenge to cut out added sugar from your life all at once. But try going without it for at least a day and then you will see how much less of it you actually need.Try swapping sweets for fruits and nuts, sugary drinks for smoothies, etc.

option.title: Task for the Day:
option.Dics: An apple a day keeps the doctor away, right? Well, eating apples alone might not do the trick, but fruits and vegetables are an essential part of a healthy diet.They are packed with nutrients and low in calories, which makes them the perfect snack, especially if you're trying to lose weight.

option.title: Fasting Tip:
option.Dics: Try to eat at least 5 servings of fruits and vegetables each day.A serving =• 1 fist-size piece of raw fruit • 14 cup of dried fruit • 1/2 cup of fresh, canned, or frozen fruit • 1 cup of any raw lettuce or spinach • /2 cup of fresh or frozen, or even canned,veggies

option.title: fasting tips
option.Dics: Just remember to check any canned fruits for added sugar because we don't want those empty calories in our diet!

option.title: Task for the Day:
option.Dics: You are already halfway through your fasting challenge, can you believe it? You're doing great – keep going!Today, you should focus on eating whole foods.

option.title: Eat Only Whole Foods
option.Dics: They are a great source of fiber (which is essential for a healthy diet) and help you feel satiated for longer. Whole food carbs can be found in whole grains, beans and peas, starchy vegetables, fruits, oats, and nuts.

option.title: fasting tips
option.Dics: Pay attention to the food labels of grains to see whether they are whole or refined. True whole grains are intact grains that have not had the fiber or bran removed. They include steel cut oats, quinoa, brown rice, wild rice, buckwheat, and wheat berries.Don't forget to reflect on the past two weeks after your fast today!

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Welcome to the third week of our challenge! For the next seven days, we will be focusing on introducing more activity into your life! Don't be scared, you can do it!Walking is a great way to start exercising because it doesn't require any special skills and can be combined with other everyday activities.

option.title: fasting tips
option.Dics: Studies show that walking 10,000 steps can help you lose weight and improve your mood. But you don't have to do it all at once! Break your walk into a few shorter ones that add up to one hour, if that's more comfortable for you.You can try walking while on work calls or while talking on the phone. Or, if you're watching tv, stand up and walk during the commercials.Allow FastEasy access to your step tracking app in the Statistics menu to see how many steps you're taking.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Hi there! Every day you're getting one step closer to your health goals, so keep it up!Today, consider exercising before your fast is over.When you're fasting, your body uses the glucose stored in the liver as glycogen to sustain itself. But after about 12 hours, the body starts to use fat for energy. That's why if you work out right before breaking your fast, you can burn even more stubborn fat.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Be kind to yourself! Some days you'll feel more energetic than others. And your energy level will definitely be different at the end of your fast.Don't know what workout to use? We've got you covered! There's a short and simple workout routine waiting for you in your Dashboard menu.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Hey! Today's task is a pleasant one – you need to get a good night's sleep.Sleeping for at least 7 hours a day doesn't only make you feel good and improve your overall health, it also helps you lose more weight! How cool is that?

option.title: How is Sleep Connected to Weight Loss?
option.Dics: When you're sleep deprived, you're cranky and more likely to reach for a cheat meal or skip on exercise. But it's not only that!Researchers have found that people who cut their sleep for more than two weeks in a row lost two times less fat. They also felt less satisfied and more hungry after meals.

option.title: Why is That?
option.Dics: Insulin is responsible for moving glucose into your cells to be used as energy. When you don't get enough sleep, your body becomes more resistant to insulin.When that happens, insulin levels increase and since it's a growth hormone, it causes you to gain extra weight.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: So, in order to lose weight and lead a healthier lifestyle, you should also make sure you're sleeping enough.It's generally recommended to sleep for 7-8 hours a night. But we all are different, so just try waking up naturally, without an alarm, for a couple days in a row to see how much sleep you really need.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: It's not only the quantity of sleep that matters, the quality is equally important.To have deep restorative sleep, make sure that you are resting in a dark, quiet place. The ideal temperature for sleeping is 60-65 degrees Fahrenheit (15-19 degrees Celsius).You can also use a sleeping mask and earplugs to make sure nothing disturbs you.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Welcome back! Today we will be trying to introduce even more activity into your life. We believe that you can do it, and so should you!The American Heart Association recommends being active for 150 minutes a week. That means that to stay healthy you need to exercise for 30 minutes 5 days a week.And that is your task for today!

option.title: DO 30 Minutes Of Exercise Today
option.Dics: Choose a type of activity that you like. Walking, jogging, cycling, swimming, yoga - anything that gets your body moving works!If you're not sure what exercise to do, we've got you! There's a simple 7minute workout in your Dashboard. You can do it a couple times a day, in between your work or daily chores, to get all the health benefits!

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: When you stay active, your body uses a lot more energy and water than in its resting state. So don't forget to hydrate during and after exercising!Drink an extra 8 oz (250 ml) of water for every 30 minutes of exercise!

fasting challenge.title: day 19 invite someone for a walk

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: Hi! We hope you've had the chance to start exercising over the past couple of days. Together with intermittent fasting, exercising can help you be more active and lose excess weight!

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Staying active on your own might be challenging. So today, invite a friend or loved one to take a walk or jog with you. Alternatively, you could just call a friend while you're walking.You might not even notice how the time flies by if you're having a lovely conversation with someone you adore!Remember, we recommend walking for around an hour a day!

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Exercising on its own gives you a boost of dopamine – a hormone that makes you feel good.But if you do it in the sun, you will increase your dopamine levels in addition to getting some essential vitamin D. Benefits all around!

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: Hello there! How's this week treating you? Remember that no matter how difficult this challenge gets, it's important to trust the process and be kind to yourself.One way of achieving that is through mindfulness.

option.title: What is Mindfulness?
option.Dics: Mindfulness is a process of noticing and labeling your own thoughts, feelings, and sensations in an objective way.It can help you stay in the moment and avoid being harsh on yourself for feeling or being a certain way.Through mindfulness you can observe and accept your thoughts and feelings, without trying to judgethem.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Your task for today is to break your fast mindfully. Try to observe the emotions, thought patterns, and sensations that the last hours of fasting bring to you.When taking your first meal of the day, try to block any distractions and focus on eating. How does the food taste? What emotions and thoughts come to the surface? Don't judge them, just observe. You can write them down after you're done with your meal.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Reflect on the past week and think about one thing you did well during it. What is one thing you can do better today? Write down an intention for yourself and put it somewhere in sight. It will help you stay focused on your goal.

fasting challenge.title: day 21 plan excercise for a week

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: You made it to the end of week 3! How are you feeling? You are our hero, congrats!It's always easier to stick to a routine if you have it all planned out and scheduled in advance. Next week we won't be reminding you to stay active, so plan your activities today for the following seven days.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Remember the rule - 30 minutes of exercise 5 days a week. Try to have a variety of workouts and activities planned out, so you don't get bored. But keep it realistic, no need to push yourself too hard!And if you ever get lost, there's a short workout waiting for you in the Dashboard every hour of every day!

fasting challenge.title: day 22 try a new meal today

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: Experts say that it takes 21 days to form a habit. So, congrats, you're on the finish line!This week we will be focusing on making your new healthy habits of fasting, eating healthy, and staying active permanent Only you can make sure that you are consistent, but we will help you as much as we can :)

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Doing the same things over and over again is essential for forming a habit. But let's be honest, it can get pretty boring. So it's also important to spice up your routine a little.Today we encourage you to eat healthy but also find a new meal or recipe to try out. There are plenty of new recipe ideas in our Insights menu, so you can choose one that looks good to you!

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: It's easier to stick to a healthy diet when you're cooking your meals at home. But how do you know what to order when eating out?Look at the menu in advance to pick out what you are going to have instead of making a hasty decision at the table. Most menus offer details about what is included with certain food items. If you have a specific question about ingredients or food preparation, you can ask yourserver.

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: Hi there! Nice to see you back!Reaching any wellness goal is impossible without taking care of your mental health. Your mood and mental state directly affect your overall well-being. So to stay healthy, you need to take care of your mind too.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: One way of doing so is to practice gratitude journaling.Today list three things that you are grateful for. Don't think too much about it, just write down whatever comes to mind - people, objects, places, moments, etc.What are those three things? How does thinking about them make you feel?

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Doing this daily promotes your overall feeling of happiness. And that will influence the amount of energy you have for reaching your health and personal goals. Everything is connected!

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: Hi there! Remember that building new habits is always hard. But you can do anything if you put your mind to it!You might've noticed that feeling hungry is a big part of going through a fasting journey, especially in those last hours of your fast. So how can you deal with it?

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Today when you're feeling hungry, get up and go for a short walk, even just around your house or apartment building. The main idea is to stop focusing on this uncomfortable sensation and distract yourself.You could also schedule a work call or some other activity for those last hours of fasting to direct your attention elsewhere.

option.title: Stay Mindful and Careful
option.Dics: However, you shouldn't ignore your body altogether. Remember about mindfulness - you can observe your hunger but you don't necessarily have to do anything about it. Keep your will strong and wait for that fast to end!However, if you're feeling poorly or your blood sugar is low, you should stop your fast earlier.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: Building habits is all about trying new activities and having pleasant experiences. So when you're on your hungry walk, call a friend to boost your dopamine levels. This will signal the brain that what you're doing is pleasant, and it will be easier to go through this routine next time!

fasting challenge.title: day 25 no social media on the fast

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: Hello, hello!Did you know that studies link EXCESSIVE social media use to depression and anxiety?Today your task will be to avoid scrolling through your feeds for the last two hours of your fast.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Those last hours can be the hardest ones to get through - you might start feeling hungry, tired, or anxious. And even though it might feel like diving nose deep into your phone might be a great option to make the time fly by, it actually isn't very useful. It will be easier for you to get triggered by certain content and start feeling low.It would be better to spend the last hours keeping busy with things that will give you a boost of dopamine – like talking to loved ones, being productive at work, doing some chores, exercising, going for a walk,

option.title: fasting tips
option.Dics: Block all social media apps on your phone for the whole fasting window or at least for the last hours of your fast.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Hi there!The best way to create a habit is to repeat your new routine over and over again until it becomes second nature.So today's task isn't new but it's a great one - try working out in the last hour of your fast. In doing so, you will burn even more fat, especially stubborn fat that our body naturally wants to hold onto.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: You can do whatever workout you want. Cardio workouts – like jogging, running, cycling, etc. – work best to burn fat.If you don't know what type of workout to pick, you can always do one from our app!

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: Hello! Did you know that high stress levels and weight gain are linked?When you have a lot of stress in your life, you tend to look for the most easily accessible comfort. That can lead to overeating. And because you worry, your insulin levels rise, which leads you to crave sweet and fatty foods even more!

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: When you are approaching the end of your fast, you might be feeling pretty hungry, maybe even hangry. That might cause you a lot of stress. So today when you start feeling hungry, try meditating.Meditation is an ancient technique that has been proven to reduce stress and anxiety. It might sound intimidating, but in reality it can be quite easy and rewarding.

option.title: How do I Meditate?
option.Dics: To practise meditation you don't need anything but yourself.When you feel especially hungry during your fast, just take 2-3 minutes to sit comfortably and be quiet. You can close your eyes or look at some object in front of you.Allow yourself to feel and think whatever comes up. Focus on the sensations in your body. How does it feel to slow down and do nothing?If you notice some unpleasant sensations, observe them and then let them go.

option.title: Fasting Tip:
option.Dics: There's no right or wrong in meditation, so you can meditate for as long as you like and in any way you prefer. Even a 3-minute meditation can significantly improve your stress levels!Also, don't expect to nail meditation on the first try! Just ease into it and think of it as practice.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Today is the last day of Week 4, can you believe it? Hopefully you were able to introduce some new habits into your routine and get more mindful about it! Anyway, we are proud of you!Today's task for you is to celebrate your achievements with a healthy and delicious meal! Make sure that it includes a lean protein, a fruit, and at least two servings of non-starchy vegetables!

option.title: Starchy vs. Non-Starchy
option.Dics: Most of the vegetables available to you are non-starchy. Here are some examples of starchy ones:• Corn • White potatoes • Sweet potatoes • Green peas • Acorn squash • Butternut squash • Pumpkin

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: To make it easier, you can use the plate method: half of your plate should be covered with veggies, a quarter with protein, and a quarter with whole grains or legumes (beans/peas).

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: So, you've officially completed four weeks of the fasting challenge, yay!Hopefully, you are used to fasting every day, eating healthier, and staying active. Now it's time to reflect on this journey.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Take time today to evaluate the time you've spent going through this challenge. What did you change about your daily routine? What did you learn about yourself?List all the changes in your life - ones you like and ones you don't - and think about how they are linked to this journey.

option.title: Fasting Tip
option.Dics: It can be helpful to look through your statistics in our app. Has your weight improved? Have you been talking more steps daily? Have you been keeping a stable water intake? These parameters are helpful when you want to see your progress!

fasting challenge.title: day 30 plan out the next month

option.title: Intro
option.Dics: Today is the last day of this fasting challenge. We thank you for your participation! No matter your results, We are proud of you for making it to the end!And even though it's the finish line for the challenge, your health journey is far from over. You need to keep your achievements from this challenge and set more ambitious goals for the future, right? Thus, it's time to make a plan.

option.title: Task of the Day
option.Dics: Your last task is simple - decide which parts of this challenge you want to keep in your daily routine.List all the activities that made you feel better and helped you move closer to your goal during this journey. Then plan out how you will hold yourself accountable for sticking to them.You can put this list on your refrigerator or send it to your friends and ask them to check in on your progress - whatever will help you stick to your new routines.

option.title: fasting tips
option.Dics: Even though our challenge is over, you still have a ton of features and insights on our app dedicated to helping you reach your goals!Make sure to check out the Insights menu regularly to stay on track with all the new info and helpful tips!See you!
